headline.main: National Briefing | West: California: Budget Expected To Fall Short By 15 Percent

lead_paragraph: The state faces its steepest decline in revenue since World War II, a legislative report says. The report forecasts a $12.4 billion shortfall, or 15 percent, in this budget year and next. Shortages could linger until 2007. California relies heavily on capital gains, income and sales tax revenues, which, already sagging, were worsened by terrorism-related layoffs and declines in tourism.
abstract: Legislative report says California faces steepest decline in revenue since World War II; forecasts $12.4 billion shortfall, or 15 percent, in current budget year and next; says shortages could linger until 2007 (S)
